author: Timothy Tiernan
text:
Crowdfunding has been successful in the private sector, particularly with Kickstarter as an example, but some have proposed crowdfunding to assist in public-sector projects (Neighbor.ly comes to mind). I'd like to gather opinions from local government administrators on this topic: Do you think crowdfunding for civic projects is a good idea, a bad idea, a mixed bag? Are you enthusiastic about the idea or perhaps cautious about possible consequences? 
My article on the eCivis blog on the civic crowdfunding (http://blog.ecivis.com/bid/109038/Crowdfunding-in-the-Public-Sector) taps some expert opinion and overlaps somewhat with Evelina Moulder's ICMA article on e-democracy participation (icma.org/en/icma/newsroom/highlights/Article/101874/EDemocracy_Improves_Trust), but I'd like to extend the discussion to see what employees at the local government level have to say about this.
What's your opinion?
Thanks in advance,
Timothy Tiernan
blog.ecivis.com
title: Crowdfunding civic projects?
